Container.Name: minimal-liquidctl
Container.Overview: A minimal Docker container that uses liquidctl to control fan speeds on supported devices. Executes a custom script every minute via cron to adjust fan speeds based on drive, NVMe, and motherboard temperatures.

Config.Name: Data Storage
Config.Description: Path to store your custom fan control script and any logs

Config.Name: Fan 1 Speeds
Config.Description: Fan speed levels corresponding to HDD thresholds

Config.Name: NVME Temp Thresholds
Config.Description: Comma-separated temperature thresholds for NVMe devices

Config.Name: Fan 2 Speeds
Config.Description: Fan speed levels corresponding to NVMe thresholds

Config.Name: MB Temp Thresholds
Config.Description: Comma-separated temperature thresholds for motherboard sensors

Config.Name: Fan 3 Speeds
Config.Description: Fan speed levels corresponding to motherboard thresholds

Config.Name: Excluded Drives from Temp Calc
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of drive IDs to exclude from temperature-based fan control

Config.Name: Number of Fans
Config.Description: How many fans you want to control (1-3)
